history.content: I have taken CS 188 and am taking CS 189 this semester, so I think I have an decent idea about this question. I believe the answer is that most of the 188 material can be learnt through self-study given the foundations in probability and machine learning. The main concepts of 188 that you may have not covered in 189, 127,or 127 are 1. reinforcement learning and 2. Bayesian Networks. If you already know about these concepts/are willing to self-study them, then there is no need to take 188. That being said, it is a pretty fun class with cool projects if you want to take it anyways :)

I believe the answer is that most of the 188 material can be learnt through self-study given the foundations in probability and machine learning. The main concepts of 188 that you may have not covered in 189, 127,or 127 are 1. reinforcement learning and 2. Bayesian Networks. If you already know about these concepts/are willing to self-study them, then there is no need to take 188. That being said, it is a pretty fun class with cool projects if you want to take it anyways :)

As title.

Is there any more information in 188 that are not covered in 189+126+127? If so, are these information useful, or can we self-study them quickly after having foundations built by 189+126+127?

Thanks!
history.subject: Is it worth to take 188 after taking 189, 126, 127?
